title: Misconceptions
comment: People say that this emulator lags but that isn't  the case. DS games are pretty intensive for mobile devices so without the latest smartphones lag and frame skips can be expected. Playing from my Galaxy S5 I don't run into these problems. I gave it 4-stars instead of 5 because I can't find where to access the options.

title: So uh.... Options are not a thing.
comment: So there is a single function. It finds any ds games, and then plays them. There are NO CUSTOMISABLE SETTINGS AT ALL, meaning that you cannot change the layout of buttons, you cannot change the emulation settings to make certain ROMs run better(which is probably the main reason everybody else is complaining about slow playback, you can only run ROMs on the default settings). This may not seem like a huge issue to anyone new to emulators, but trust me, you NEED custom settings to run certain games properly.

title: Awesome
comment: Once you fiddle around with the settings a bit, it plays almost as fast as a real DS! The only thing holding me back from giving it a 5-star rating is that there should be holdable buttons like in SuperN64 (N64 emu)-- for instance, in Mario Kart, there's a mission that requires you to perform a powerslide, but as my device only supports 2 finger multitouch, this is not possible for me. Still, I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a mobile DS emulator. Keep up the good work, and best of luck to the devs!
